clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Plasmalyte A, Normal Saline and Ringer Lactate as Intraoperative Fluid During Renal Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Plasmalyte A, Normal Saline and Ringer Lactate as Intraoperative Fluids in Patients Undergoing Renal Transplantation.

lead_sponsor.agency: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research

clinical_study.source: Postgraduate Institute of Medical Education and Research

brief_summary.textblock: Fluid management being an important component of surgery becomes more challenging for an anesthesiologist in case of renal transplant. Ischemia-reperfusion injury is an inevitable consequence of kidney transplantation, leading to metabolic acidosis .Normal saline (NS; 0.9% NaCl) is administered during kidney transplantation to avoid the risk of hyperkalemia associated with potassium-containing fluids. Plasmalyte is another fluid which can be used and probably will lead to better metabolic profile in these group of patients.The primary objective of this study will be to compare the effects of using normal saline (NS), Ringer lactate and Plasmalyte as intravenous fluids on acid-base balance and electrolytes during living donor kidney transplantation. Secondary outcomes assessed will be the effect on renal function.

primary_outcome.measure: acid base balance, 4 readings intraoperaively to be taken using arterial blood sample of the patient
primary_outcome.description: pH, pCO2, pO2, HCO3,Base deficit, Na, K are the values normally measured in acid base analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: serum creatinine on day 1, 2 and 7 of surgery
secondary_outcome.description: This is a function of kidney measure and will tell about the success of Renal Transplant

arm_group.description: Intravenous fluid used in these patients would be normal saline which would be given intravenously during intraoperative and postoperative period
Intravenous fluid used in these patients would be ringer lactate which would be given intravenously during intraoperative and postoperative period
Intravenous fluid used in this arm in patients would be plasmalyte A which would be given intravenously during intraoperative and postoperative period

intervention.intervention_name: intravenous fluid administration WITH NORMAL SALINE, PLASMALYTE A, OR RINGER LACTATE
intervention.description: intravenous fluid to be used for maintainance and replacement during renal transplant surgery will be normal saline, ringer lactate or plasmalyte A depending on the arm of intervention
